node.description: This module contains counters and control registers of all the optical links on the board (regardless of link rate or what they connect to)
User programmable board ID that gets embedded in the DAQ data stream
When set to 1 external trigger is enabled

Sets the minimum separation of consecutive external triggers in BX (any trigger that comes in earlier after last trigger than the set value will be discarded). Default is set to 400 to limit the rate to 100kHz
Sets the PCIe packet size in bytes for CVP13 DAQ -- this should match the read size in the DAQ application. Higher size should result in higher throughput.

Sets the PCIe packet timeout in units of AXI clock cycles (250MHz) -- if the packet builder does not receive enough data to fill make PCIE_PACKET_SIZE packet in this time, it will send a shorter packet with the data available.
Firmware release date (read as hex, format: ddmmyyyy)
Firmware release time (read as hex, format: 00HHMMSS)
Type of board that this firmware is running on: 0 = GLIB; 1 = CTP7; 2 = CVP13; 3 = APEX; 4 = X2O
The number of logic optical links that this board has.
The number of MGTs that are intantiated in this firmware.

Link ${LINK} settings. Link number is logical link number that generally goes in sequence with the transceiver placement on the board and natural fiber numbers in the transceiver. For more details on link numbering on any specific board, please refer to the 0xBEFE repository doc directory.
If this is 1 it means that this TX channel is inverted on the board, so software should compensate for that by setting the opposite polarity on the corresponding MGT channel.
If this is 1 it means that this RX channel is inverted on the board, so software should compensate for that by setting the opposite polarity on the corresponding MGT channel.
